spanGrp.span: On a day, in the days and times of the prophet Muḥammad, peace and blessing be upon him, they were going to the war, to the war, they were away for a week, fifteen days, twenty days in the war

When they went, they stayed in the war, then they started to come back from the war to their houses, someone was with the companiers of the prophet, his name was Nifil, he was with the prophet, peace and blessing be upon him. Nifil

died in this war, he had become a martyr, I mean, he had been killed, dead, he had become a martyr, and the prophet, peace and blessing be upon him, ˁAli and Abu Bakr aṣ-ṣaddīq (the honest) had burried him, where he died, and were on their way home.

Nifil, when his housekeeper, his wife, of course had fears in her heart, whether her husband was dead, let’s say, or she was afraid, she had fears on her, she stopped by the companiers and the prophet, while they were on their way, she was waiting for them. First, the prophet’s convoy was in the front,
she went towards it and said: “O, beloved by God, messenger of God! My husband, Nifil, where is he? didn’t he go with them, I see he is not here, he is not with you.”

The prophet, peace and blessing be upon him, looked around and said (to himself): “What do I want to/ What should I tell this woman, if I tell her, I will let her down, I will disappoint her, or I don’t know how to say, I mean that I will make her sad.” He looked behind him like this

when he looked behind him, ˁAli, may God bless him, was in the second convoy, the second. ˁAli’s convoy was coming, so she asked him the same (question) She said to him: “O ˁAli, I see my man, my housekeeper, Nifil
I have asked the prophet, and he said ask ˁAli, do you know where he is, in which convoy?” ˁAli, may God bless him said (to himself): “How can I let this woman down, disappoint her?

the prophet, blessings and peace be upon him hasn’t told her, and how am I supposed to tell her?” So he looked behind him like this, where he saw Abu Bakir aṣ-ṣadīq’s convoy. Abu Bakir aṣ-ṣiddīq, which means “the honest” is honest, he doesn’t... the honest must be honest.
He said: “Ask him, like that” He pointed with his finger to behind him saying: “Ask Abu Bakir, he is coming, maybe he knows”

Again, Abu Bakir came, when Abu Bakir aṣ-ṣiddīq had come, she said to him: “O Abu Bakir, my husband Nifil, I see he is not with you, he is not with the convoy, he is not with the companiers, didn’t he go with you? where is he?” Abu Bakir aṣ-ṣiddīq looked around and said (to himself):
“God’s messenger has not told her, ˁAli has not told her, how can I?” When he looked behind him like this, no one was left, let’s say, so he would point with his finger to behind him.

He shouted: “God!” Abu Bakir aṣ-ṣiddīq shouted “God!” When he shouted “God!” like this turning around, (suddenly) Nifil was riding on his horse and coming behind him. He said “Ma’am, there he is coming behind me” She said to him “all good, thank you, he has come”

When Abu Bakr aṣ-ṣiddīq was, his blood was in his hands (it was his responsobility), his blood was in his hands, and came, when he shouted “God”, he (Nifil) came behind him. He came to God’s messenger, they, “their leader and beloved, Muḥammad!” He came to God’s messenger, and said “O God’s messenger!

What is going on? How did this matter happen?” He said “Why, Abu Bakir?” He said “I shouted that you hadn’t told her and ˁAli hadn’t told her, and I called God and suddenly Nifil was behind me riding on the horse, donkey, and coming. What is the wisdom of this?” He said to him “Abu Bakr aṣ-ṣiddīq, since you are ṣiddīq (honest)
you can not, God forbid, God forbid, you can not lie, you did not point with your hand, you only want to be honest” his name is ṣiddīq (honest)

“When you called God, lord of the worlds, with his glory and majesty, God sent me Ğabrāyīl and said to me “Tell my beloved to tell Abu Bakir, Abu Bakir, if he would have shouted twice, two times, God, in this war, how many died, have become martyrs, have become dead, five hundred or one thousand or seven hundred

if he had shouted twice “God” I would have revived all of them and sent them with Nifil, but he shouted only once for Nifil, so I just revived Niffil for him. As soon as he shouted “God” once, I immediatly gave him his soul, I gave Niffil’s soul back to... to his body

and in the blink of an eye, I made him behind Abu Bakr aṣ-ṣiddīq, so he won’t be a liar, so his words will always be ṣiddīq (honest)” so as for (the fact) that he was behind him, that is how this matter is”
